title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrect about custom cookie name affecting URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrectly states that a custom cookie name affects URL rewriting.
OB: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL. However, the observed behavior is that the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE', but the 'Reload' link on the page uses the default 'jsessionid' instead.
EB: The expected behavior is that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the custom name should be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL, provided that URL rewriting has been enabled.
SR: To reproduce the issue:1. Deploy the attached 'cookiename.war' file.2. Access 'http://localhost:8080/cookiename/'.3. Verify that the cookie sent has the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE', but the 'Reload' link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead of the custom name.
